cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move slowly northwest today, then turn north and parallel the U.S. southeast Atlantic coast, passing close to the Florida east coast, Georgia, South Carolina and likely making its closest approach/landfall near the North Carolina coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks / southeast North Carolina coast
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Storm remains offshore of Manatee County Port, FL throughout the forecast – effectively 0 hours

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL and from north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC (all on Atlantic side)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Atlantic side); Storm Surge Warning Lantana FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coast from South Florida northward through Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty outer-band winds possible; probability of sustained tropical-storm force winds only 11%
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected on the Gulf side; surge warnings confined to Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches; heavy core rainfall stays on Atlantic side
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal – possible brief squalls and higher than normal tides but no major operational hazard expected
